result.execSummary:
The defendant Alex J Platta was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st or 2nd Degree Sexual Assault), a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharges.   25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Complete a psychological assessment and comply with recommendations.

No contact with the victim or the victim's family.
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies) and or treatment.
Provide agent with list of medications.
Use One pharmacy for prescriptions.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Provide DNA sample.
30 days for the state to provide any restitutution requests.
*Per Court order signed on 02/24/16 no restitution due

records.addlTxt:
9:42 a.m. Defendant Alex J Platta in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Defendant Alex J Platta in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties received and reviewed the PSI report and Addendum. The State provides victim statements/letters.
9:45 a.m. Court in recess to allow the Court to read victim statements. 
10:21 a.m. Court back in session. Court received a letter from Defendant's sister. Atty Redfield did not have a copy and has not read that one yet with his client.  Court provides copy to Atty Redfield. 
10:33 a.m. Atty Redfield calls first witness who is sworn in testifies during direct exam. No cross exam.
Atty Redfield calls second witness who is sworn in testifies during direct exam. No cross exam.
Atty Redfield calls second witness who is sworn in testifies during direct exam. No cross exam.
ADA Cousins makes sentencing recommendations of 20 yrs prison at 10 yrs In and 10 yrs ES.
Atty Redfield makes argument for a lesser sentence and states there are 119 days credit.
Defendant makes apologetic statements.
Court considers a number of factors according to law.
BTC:**************PRISON****
948.025(1)(E) Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child:
15 yrs prison is 8 yr In & 7 yr ES
Conditions as stated on the record:
No contact with the victim or the victim's family.
 AODA & comply with treatment recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Complete a psychological assessment and comply with recommendations.
Comply with any other assessments, treatment, and programming as deemed appropriate by the Compas assessment and the Department of Corrections.
Sign releases of information forms for offender's assessments, medication/pharmacy(ies and or treatment.
Provide agent with list of medications.
Use One pharmacy for prescriptions.
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment or be enrolled in and attend school full time, or a combination of both resulting in full time.
Provide DNA sample.
Costs and surcharges including DNA surcharge.
Not eligible for programs.
Credit 119 days credit.
30 days for the state to provide any restitutution requests.

Appeal rights provided.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing at 12-23-2015 09:30 am

Defendant Alex J Platta in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Defendant Alex J Platta in custody. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:45 a.m.  Court calls the case. 

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of:  NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Court orders a PSI. 
PSI to be completed by 12/16/15 with copies forwarded to counsel to prepare for sentencing arguments. 
Bond and conditions of bond are continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 23, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Plea hearing at 10-23-2015 11:45 am
(for HIV/STI Testing)

Defendant Alex J Platta in court with attorney Jared Redfield. Defendant Alex J Platta in custody. David Knaapen appearing on behalf of Cass W Cousins for the State of Wisconsin.
Set for an Arraignment and Motion Hearing.

9:10 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Pre-Trial to Commence today and report to be filed with the Court.
Atty Redfield stated that there is a Plea Hearing scheduled for October 23, 2015.

BY THE COURT:
NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.
Bond and Conditions of Bond are Ordered Continued.


Motion Hearing:
Court questions Atty Redfield.
Atty Redfield indicates that his client will not contest the HIV/STI Testing as requested by the mother of the victim.

BY THE COURT:
Court signs the order requesting the defendant to have HIV/SIT Testing.
Order signed by the Court as of today's date.
9/28 Arraignment - No Such Number - Unable to Forward
for HIV/STI Testing w/ Proposed Order
Arraignment at 09-28-2015 09:00 am
& Proposed Order to Bind Over
Atty Redfield
Motion and Order to Seal from Public Inspection "Identity of Witness"
Identity of Witness
Preliminary hearing at 09-28-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Alex J Platta appeared by video. Attorney Jared Redfield in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Atty Knaapen indicates the State has filed a Victim Key and asks that information be sealed.  An order has been prepared. 
Atty Redfield does not object. 
BY THE COURT:  Court orders the Identifying Witness is sealed from public inspection.

Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Knaapen asks bond be continued. 
Atty Redfield makes arguments re: bond. Asks bond be reduced to $5,000 cash. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Atty Renc

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  C.F. DOB 9-12-2000 or any members of her family or her residence.
Not possess any firearms or dangerous weapons.
Report alcohol and drug free to the Day Report Center no less than the following times per week:  7 times per week
No contact with CF or any of her family members is a condition of confinement.

ADA Cousins  appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
State requests a $50,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.

Initial Appearance Scheduled for: 8-31-15  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3
